summary: Denali, formerly known as Mount McKinley, is the tallest mountain in North America, standing at 20,310 feet. It's located in Alaska and is part of Denali National Park. The local Koyukon people have called it Denali for centuries. The mountain's name was officially changed from Mount McKinley to Denali in 2015. The first successful climb to the summit was in 1913. Denali is challenging to climb, with the easiest route being the West Buttress.
title: Denali
